td.p: Thomson, John. Journal, Mackenzie River, 1800-1802. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0021

div.p: 7 Cascamisks, 1 Skin of Grease, 1 small depouille, 2 porcupine Belts, 1 origl skin, 3 weazles, 1 Carribou collet, 5 skins hare snares, & half a do of Spunk – gave out 182 skins on Credit – desired La Violette to prepare himself to go & pass the Winter with these Indians[.] I cannot say whether it is Sickness or Laziness (for he has a very good Appetite) that has prevented him from Stirring about a little – forever since he has been here he has not once attempted to cut a single stick of wood, or go for a Drop of water & in short to do the least kind of work whatsoever – unless it is 15 or 20 Snares that he set near the house & I believe it is now 4 days since he resseted them – in fact the Man is quite a mere Barther[.] The 2 hunters arrived[,] they brought 77 hares[.] I always make a point to get all the information I can from every band of Indians that arrives, concerning those whom I have not yet seen who owe Credits – altho they are not very communicative on that subject. I have discovered this morning that 3 of them all Brothers, had made a shift last Spring to steal 20 Skins of Credits[.] Very luckily the sick Man that is now in the House happens to be one of them. The Rascal had assured me that he never saw any Fort – which all the others then present confirmed. I now told him that nothing else but that is the reason of he & several of his Relations being sick &c &c[.] [W]hat I have said seems to have made a great impression upon them and I dare say it will be the means of preventing them from again attempting the like[.]

Monday the 15th[.] In the foren[o]on the Indians went away[,] sent La Violette along with them, gave him a Dram & about 2½ skins worth of Meat, & to each of the Indians one hare[.] They would have gone away yesterday but La Violette is such a Slow creeping Man – that he took the whole day yesterday & all this morning to get himself Ready[.] [T]he y Man whom I employed the 12th Inst came from the other side, he brought 20 hares[.]
